title: [BSOG0008] Garmisch - Garmisch
description:

In that time, theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve released a couple incredible EPs on the Swedish netlabel Go, Jukebox! and performed live, on and off, in the MalmÃƒÂ¶ region. From the beginning, theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve put together a mixture of influences and ideas, however, theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re still trying to find their intended style; they have no intensions of ever really doing so. ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s five of them in the band, mostly good people Ã¢â‚¬â€ Stefan Bodetoft, Charlotte Fagerlund, Charlotte Lundgren, Birgitta Persson & Patrik Svensson. Their influences are as far-ranging as Curtis Mayfield, Pink Floyd, DÃ¢â‚¬â„¢Angelo, Massive Attack, Gary Numan, The Stooges, Portishead, Emmylou Harris & Wu-Tang Clan.

If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re at all familiar with Swedish pop music, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll no doubt already know that itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s quite infectious. Garmisch is no different. Well over a year in the making, the self-titled Ã¢â‚¬Å“GarmischÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ album captures much of what made both of their previous EPs so special and manages to add to that more polished production and mastering. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re familiar with GarmischÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ previous work, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re guaranteed to thoroughly enjoy it. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re new to Garmisch, this is the perfect place to introduce yourself to their sound.
